metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11190 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 4.8 allows local users to bypass ASLR on setuidprograms (such as /bin/su) because install_exec_creds() is called too latein load_elf_binary() in fs/binfmt_elf.c, and thus the ptrace_may_access()check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-149.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-149.175
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1110.118
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1114.119
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1084.94
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1047.53
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-149.175').
